subject: Personal Finance
title: Demand-Pull Inflation
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Demand-Pull Inflation.

hook.text: Too many buyers chasing too few goods. Prices rise because everyone wants the same thing.

buildup.text: When the economy booms, employment rises and people have more money to spend.

discovery.text: If production can't keep up with demand, sellers raise prices. That's demand-pull inflation.

twist.text: Stimulus checks during COVID boosted demand while supply chains were broken. Prices surged.

climax.text: Demand-pull is the most common inflation trigger and usually the easiest for central banks to fight.

punchline.text: More buyers plus fewer goods equals higher prices.
